info.name: ExamSystem
info.description:
# ExamSystem API

A unified API for managing users, roles, permissions, departments, students, exams, launching sessions, submitting answers, and viewing results/history.

- API root: `{{base_url}}{{api_prefix}}` (documentation variables)
    
- Default base URL: `http://localhost:8000`
    
- Default API prefix: `/api`
    

Authentication

- Type: Bearer token
    
- How to obtain and use  
    1) Call `POST /api/login` with `{ email, password }` to obtain a token.  
    2) Send header `Authorization: Bearer` on protected endpoints.  
    3) Use `POST /api/logout` (current session) or `POST /api/logoutAll` (all sessions) to revoke tokens.
    

Common headers

- `Authorization: Bearer` — Protected endpoints
    
- `Content-Type: application/json` — POST/PUT with JSON body
    
- `Accept: application/json` — All JSON endpoints
    

Error model and examples

- 400 Bad Request → `{ "message": "Bad Request" }`
    
- 401 Unauthenticated → `{ "message": "Unauthenticated" }`
    
- 403 Forbidden → `{ "message": "Forbidden" }`
    
- 404 Not Found → `{ "message": "Not Found" }`
    
- 422 Validation error → `{ "message": "Validation error", "errors": { "field": ["..."] } }`
    
- 429 Too Many Requests → `{ "message": "Too Many Requests" }`
    
- 500 Server error → `{ "message": "Server error" }`
    

Pagination and filtering

- Unless specified by the endpoint, typical patterns may include `?page=&per_page=` and resource-specific filters such as `?user_id=`.
    
- Sort, search, and other filters are implementation-specific.
    

Notes

- Use `{{base_url}}{{api_prefix}}` as the API root in examples.
    
- All timestamps are ISO 8601 unless specified.
    
- IDs are integers unless specified.
    

Folders and purpose

- User — Manage users: list, detail, create, update, delete, and view a user's exam history.
    
- Image — Serve static images stored by the system (public endpoints).
    
- Exam — CRUD for exams.
    
- Department — CRUD for departments.
    
- Student — CRUD for students.
    
- LaunchExam — Start an exam and provision a session.
    
- Result — Retrieve attempt history and per-exam results for a user.
    
- Login — Authenticate and manage sessions/tokens.
    
- Permission — CRUD for permissions.
    
- UserRole — Assign and manage roles for users.
    
- Role — CRUD for roles.
    
- RolePermission — Manage permissions on roles (view/add/update/delete).
    

Endpoint overview (see individual requests for examples)

- Users: `GET /api/users`, `GET /api/users/{id}`, `POST /api/users`, `POST /api/users/{id}` (update), `DELETE /api/users/{id}`
    
- Roles: `GET /api/roles`, `POST /api/roles`, `PUT /api/roles/{id}`, `DELETE /api/roles/{id}`
    
- Permissions: `GET /api/permissions`, `POST /api/permissions`, `PUT /api/permissions/{id}`, `DELETE /api/permissions/{id}`
    
- Role permissions: `GET/POST/PUT /api/roles/{roleId}/permissions`, `DELETE /api/roles/{roleId}/permissions/{permissionKey}`
    
- Departments: `GET /api/departments`, `GET/PUT/DELETE /api/departments/{id}`, `POST /api/departments`
    
- Students: `GET /api/students`, `GET/PUT/DELETE /api/students/{id}`, `POST /api/students`
    
- Exams: `GET /api/exams`, `GET/PUT/DELETE /api/exams/{id}`, `POST /api/exams`, `POST /api/exams/add`
    
- Launch/Submit: `GET /api/exams/{id}/launch`, `POST /api/exams/{id}/submit`
    
- Results/History: `GET /api/history?user_id=...`, `GET /api/single_exam_history/{attempt_id}?user_id=...&exam_id=...`
    
- Login/Logout: `POST /api/login`, `POST /api/logout`, `POST /api/logoutAll`
    
- Images: `GET /storage/images/{filename}`
    

Tip: Each request in the collection contains at least one example response to illustrate a successful result. Use these to mock or document expected payload shapes.

body.raw:
{
            "title": "New Exam Title",
            "tagline": "This is a great tagline",
            "exam_date": "2025-09-25",
            "exam_start_time": "09:10:00",
            "exam_end_time": "10:30:00",
            "instruction": "Read instructions carefully. This is a new exam.",
            "full_mark": 10,
            "duration": 5000,
            "can_view_result": 0,
            "is_question_random": 1,
            "is_option_random": 0,
            "is_signin_required": 1,
            "is_specific_student": null
        }

{
        "title": "New Exam Title Up",
        "tagline": "This is a great tagline",
        "exam_date": "2025-09-26",
        "exam_start_time": "09:10:00",
        "exam_end_time": "10:30:00",
        "instruction": "Read instructions carefully. This is a new exam.",
        "full_mark": 80,
        "duration": 5100,
        "can_view_result": 1,
        "is_question_random": 1,
        "is_option_random": 0,
        "is_signin_required": 1,
        "is_specific_student": null
    }
